channel.title: World News Headlines, Latest International News, World Breaking News - Times of India
channel.description: World News: TOI brings the latest world news headlines, Current International breaking news world wide. In depth analysis and top news headlines world wide.

image.title: World News Headlines, Latest International News, World Breaking News - Times of India

item.title: US elections 2024: Who is Kash Patel, ‘the man who will do anything for Trump’
item.description: Kash Patel, a lawyer with limited government experience, rapidly ascended in the Trump administration since 2019. His loyalty earned him key Defense and Intelligence roles, drawing criticism. Post-administration, Patel stays close to Trump, involved in promotional activities, writing, and testifying in investigations. Challenges may await him in any future Trump presidency.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 'Not merely due to diet ...': Tammy Slaton on her weight loss journey after losing 226 kg
item.description: Tammy Slaton, known from TLC's 1000-Lb Sisters, shared her remarkable journey of losing 500 pounds on Instagram. By posting photos, she reflects on her progress and aims to inspire others. Slaton discussed overcoming past struggles with weight, alcohol, and lifestyle changes, emphasizing her mission to spread positivity and support.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 'Zuckerberg will spend lifetime in jail if ...': Trump accuses Meta chief of plotting against him during 2020 election
item.description: In 'Save America,' Donald Trump accuses Mark Zuckerberg of sabotaging his 2020 campaign despite cordial meetings. Trump claims Zuckerberg plotted against him while funding election infrastructure. He warns Zuckerberg of prison if illegal actions occur in future elections. This follows Zuckerberg's remarks on government pressure to censor COVID-19 content.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Who is Natasha Danish Ali? Pakistani woman accused of killing two while driving
item.description: On August 19, 2024, Karachi's Karsaz Road witnessed a tragic accident caused by Natasha Danish Ali, leading to the deaths of two individuals. The incident sparked public outrage due to her reckless driving and apparent indifference captured on video. Natasha, currently in judicial custody, faces manslaughter charges and has been claimed to be under the influence of crystal meth.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Who is Nikolai Durov? Telegram co-founder and Pavel's brother also wanted by French authorities
item.description: French authorities have issued arrest warrants for Nikolai and Pavel Durov, co-founders of the messaging platform Telegram. They are accused of not cooperating in a police inquiry into child sex abuse. While Pavel is the public face, Nikolai is recognized for his technical expertise and contributions to Telegram's encryption protocols, making the platform secure for its users.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Japan to provide financial assistance to single women to move out of Tokyo for marriage
item.description: Japan will initiate a program in fiscal 2025 to support single women moving from Tokyo to rural areas for marriage. The program will cover travel expenses for matchmaking events and offer financial incentives for relocation. This aims to address the declining number of young women in rural areas, a key concern in Japan's demographic crisis.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 'No one can go outside': Israeli launches deadly operation in West Bank as Gaza war rages
item.description: Israel's large-scale military operation in the occupied West Bank caused 11 Palestinian fatalities, including militants and civilians. The United Nations and Palestinian health ministry reported disruptions to medical services. Amid ongoing Gaza conflict, international voices, including Jordan's monarchy, called for a ceasefire to halt the escalating violence. Israel targeted infrastructure and addressed security concerns, intensifying regional tensions.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Pavel Durov: From Russia's Zuckerberg to France's wanted man - What are the charges and implications?
item.description: Telegram's founder, Pavel Durov, has been arrested in France during an investigation into criminal activities on the platform. This has reignited global discussions about online privacy and governmental oversight. Telegram maintains its compliance with EU laws. Different countries have reacted variably, emphasizing the ongoing debate between digital freedom and regulation.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Ministers eye extending smoking ban to outdoor venues across UK
item.description: UK ministers plan to extend the indoor smoking ban to outdoor venues, including pub gardens and football stadiums. Prime Minister Keir Starmer, backed by Chris Whitty, believes the health benefits will outweigh the impact on the hospitality sector. Public consultation will determine the final decision. This move aims to contribute to the goal of a smoke-free England by 2030.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 'Curious' kid accidentally breaks 3,500-year-old artifact in Israel's museum
item.description: A small boy broke a 3,500-year-old jar at an Israel museum. The jar, from the Bronze Age, was displayed without protective barriers, and the curious child, who went to see what was inside, pulled on it which led to the shattering of jar. The museum has enlisted a conservation specialist for restoration. Last year, an American tourist damaged Roman statues in Jerusalem, stating they were against his religious beliefs.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: JD Vance slams media over Trump’s Arlington incident: 'There’s no story'; Veterans call VP candidate 'spineless, gutless fraud'
item.description: During a rally in Erie, Pennsylvania, Ohio Senator JD Vance condemned the media for overstating an incident involving Donald Trump’s campaign at Arlington National Cemetery, asserting they had proper authorization. Vance also criticized Vice President Kamala Harris for her role in the U.S. military's withdrawal from Afghanistan, further intensifying the political discourse.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 'Highest-level warnings' issued as Typhoon Shanshan makes landfall in Japan
item.description: Typhoon Shanshan struck Kyushu in Japan, causing severe rainfall, strong winds, and leading to three deaths and several injuries. The Japan Meteorological Agency issued top-level warnings, urging residents to take shelter. The storm disrupted power, flights, and trains, sparking concerns about flooding and landslides.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: United Airlines flight makes emergency landing after severe turbulence, many injured
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: JD Vance’s donut shop disaster: 'Felt terrible ...', Trump's running mate breaks silence on viral cringe
item.description: Ohio Senator JD Vance addressed a viral incident at a Valdosta, Georgia donut shop, where his campaign stop became awkward and heavily criticized online. Vance attributed the mishap to the clerk's nervousness due to the large presence of Secret Service agents and media. He also mentioned potential changes to his campaign strategy to prevent similar issues.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Who is Fatemeh Mohajerani, Iran's first woman spokesperson
item.description: In a historic move, President Masoud Pezeshkian appointed Fatemeh Mohajerani as Iran's new government spokesperson, marking the first time a woman holds this position. Mohajerani, with a Doctorate in Business Administration, brings significant experience from previous roles in education and government. She joins other high-ranking women like Shina Ansari and Farzaneh Sadeq Malvajard.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: WHO raises concern over 'worrying' decline in condom use among European teens
item.description: According to a WHO report, European teens' condom use has notably declined, raising the risk of STIs and unplanned pregnancies. The survey exposes significant drops in protected sex among teenagers and highlights socioeconomic disparities. WHO emphasizes comprehensive sexuality education and urges immediate government and health authority action to address these issues.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 'If Elon Musk fails to ...': Brazil threatens to block X within 24 hours
item.description: Brazil's Supreme Federal Court asked Elon Musk to appoint a legal representative for his social media platform X within 24 hours or risk suspension in the country. This follows recent staff reductions in Brazil and ongoing disputes involving free speech, far-right accounts, and misinformation. X alleges coercion from Minister Alexandre de Moraes in this matter.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: US elections 2024: JD Vance accuses Kamala Harris of running a 'copycat campaign', criticizes VP on policy shifts during Pennsylvania event
item.description: Ohio Senator JD Vance accused Vice President Kamala Harris of mimicking Donald Trump’s campaign, citing her shifts in policy on issues like electric vehicle mandates and fracking. He argued that her policies would hurt American truckers, while Harris’s campaign countered by emphasizing their differences on key issues such as abortion rights and tax policies.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Having a family is expensive. Here's what Harris and Trump have said about easing costs
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: US elections: Trump reposts a vulgar remark about Kamala Harris on social media, sparks row
item.description: Donald Trump took to Truth Social to repost a crude remark about Vice President Kamala Harris, suggesting she advanced her career through sexual favors, referencing her past relationship with Willie Brown. This post sparked criticism for its explicit nature and added to Trump's history of sexist attacks against political opponents, reflecting his controversial behavior.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk
